class (Monad p, Functor p) => Persistent p where
createImpl :: String -> [(String, DBValue)] -> p Int
addRelationImpl :: Int -> Int -> String -> p ()
findRelationImpl :: Either Int Int -> String -> p [Int]
findImpl :: Int -> String -> [String] -> p (Maybe [DBValue])
findAllImpl :: String -> [String] -> p [[DBValue]]
updateImpl :: Int -> String -> [(String, DBValue)] -> p ()
createSchemaForEntity :: String -> [String] -> p ()
createSchemaForRelationship :: String -> p ()

Add a relation between entities of type a and b.

Finds an entity by reference.

Functions exposed for auto-generated code
createSchemaEntity_ :: (Regular a, DatabaseRepr (PF a), Persistent p) => a -> p ()
Create the schema for entities of type a. The argument may be undefined (it's only necessary for the type)
createSchemaRelationship_ :: Persistent p => Relation a b -> p ()
Create the schema for the relationship
data Ref a
A reference to an entity of type a. Never construct these values manually: the implementation is exposed so that new backends can make use of it.
Constructors
Ref
refKey :: Int
Instances
Show (Ref a)
create_ :: (Regular a, DatabaseRepr (PF a), Persistent p) => a -> p (Ref a)
Creates a new value. To assure your database stays correct, never use this function directly.
data Relation a b
Describes a relation between a and b. Never construct these values manually.
Constructors
Relation
relTableName :: String
class (Monad p, Functor p) => Persistent p where
This is the class backends need to implement

-> [(String, DBValue)]Keys and values

-> IntThe id of the second entity
-> StringThe tableName

:: Either Int IntLeft means the left side of the relation, Right the right side.
-> StringThe tableName
-> p [Int]The result is a list of matching ids

-> StringThe tableName
-> [String]A list of fields that need to be fetch
-> p (Maybe [DBValue])If the record is found, a Just containing the values for the fields
